title: How to Make Cotton Candy Cupcakes

steps.headline: Prepare to make the cupcakes.
steps.description: Lay 20 paper cases into a cupcake tray or spray with non-stick greasing spray if no cases are available. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit or 190 degrees Celsius.

steps.headline: Cream the butter, sugar, and vanilla.
steps.description: In a large bowl, use an electric or hand blender to cream the sugar, butter, and vanilla extract until light and fluffy. Set aside.

steps.headline: Mix the dry ingredients.
steps.description: In a separate medium-sized bowl, combine the cake flour, baking powder, and salt. Use a wooden spoon to mix.

steps.headline: Pour the dry ingredients with the wet ingredients.
steps.description: Pour the bowl of dry ingredients into with the butter mixture. On slow speed, blend in circular motions to properly combine the batter. Add the milk. Blend again until there are no more flour streaks and the batter is glossy.

steps.headline: Scoop the batter into the cupcake tray.
steps.description: Using an ice cream scoop, scoop the cupcake batter into each case of the cupcake tray. Provide each case with the exact same amount. Avoid adding too much batter in one case or your cupcakes will overflow. At the same, don't add too little batter or your cupcakes have a high chance of burning.

steps.headline: Bake in the oven.
steps.description: Place the cupcake tray in the oven for baking. Have it bake until the cupcakes rise and the sides turn slightly brown. It will usually take about 15-20 minutes.

steps.headline: Have the cupcakes cool.
steps.description: Remove the cupcakes carefully from the oven using oven mitts. Have the cupcakes cool on top of the oven or on a wire rack. Have them cool for about 5-7 minutes.

steps.headline: Separate the frosting.
steps.description: Split the frosting into two equal amounts. Place the two amounts into two medium-sized bowls.

steps.headline: Add pink food coloring to the first bowl.
steps.description: Add 7 drops of pink food coloring to the first bowl. Mix the color in using a fork, until the frosting turns a light pink.

steps.headline: Add light blue food coloring in the second bowl.
steps.description: Add 5 drops of light blue food coloring to the second bowl. Use a different fork to mix the color, to avoid combining the pink frosting with the blue..

steps.headline: Place both frostings in the frosting pipe.
steps.description: Place the pink frosting on one side of the frosting pipe and the light blue on the other side, making it equal by half and half. That way, when you frost the cupcakes, the colors won't combine together and spoil the cotton candy look.

steps.headline: Top the cupcakes off with cotton candy.
steps.description: An absolute must to finish off your cupcakes is adding the cotton candy. Grab enough cotton candy to decorate the cupcakes, but not too much to cover the frosting. Continue to frost and add cotton candy on all of the cupcakes. Serve.

text: Making the Cupcakes Prepare to make the cupcakes. Lay 20 paper cases into a cupcake tray or spray with non-stick greasing spray if no cases are available. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit or 190 degrees Celsius. Cream the butter, sugar, and vanilla. In a large bowl, use an electric or hand blender to cream the sugar, butter, and vanilla extract until light and fluffy. Set aside. Mix the dry ingredients. In a separate medium-sized bowl, combine the cake flour, baking powder, and salt. Use a wooden spoon to mix. Pour the dry ingredients with the wet ingredients. Pour the bowl of dry ingredients into with the butter mixture. On slow speed, blend in circular motions to properly combine the batter. Add the milk. Blend again until there are no more flour streaks and the batter is glossy. Scoop the batter into the cupcake tray. Using an ice cream scoop, scoop the cupcake batter into each case of the cupcake tray. Provide each case with the exact same amount. Avoid adding too much batter in one case or your cupcakes will overflow. At the same, don't add too little batter or your cupcakes have a high chance of burning. Bake in the oven. Place the cupcake tray in the oven for baking. Have it bake until the cupcakes rise and the sides turn slightly brown. It will usually take about 15-20 minutes. Have the cupcakes cool. Remove the cupcakes carefully from the oven using oven mitts. Have the cupcakes cool on top of the oven or on a wire rack. Have them cool for about 5-7 minutes. Frosting and Serving Separate the frosting. Split the frosting into two equal amounts. Place the two amounts into two medium-sized bowls. Add pink food coloring to the first bowl. Add 7 drops of pink food coloring to the first bowl. Mix the color in using a fork, until the frosting turns a light pink. Add light blue food coloring in the second bowl. Add 5 drops of light blue food coloring to the second bowl. Use a different fork to mix the color, to avoid combining the pink frosting with the blue.. Place both frostings in the frosting pipe. Place the pink frosting on one side of the frosting pipe and the light blue on the other side, making it equal by half and half. That way, when you frost the cupcakes, the colors won't combine together and spoil the cotton candy look. Top the cupcakes off with cotton candy. An absolute must to finish off your cupcakes is adding the cotton candy. Grab enough cotton candy to decorate the cupcakes, but not too much to cover the frosting. Continue to frost and add cotton candy on all of the cupcakes. Serve. Enjoy!
